results.abstract: N Ephron article on him and men's wear designing career; illus; full name is William Ralph Blass

headline.main: The Man in The Bill Blass Suit; They said it couldn't happen in men's wear . . . but the fashion revolution has come and even old birds are sprouting new feathers

results.snippet: ONE day not long ago, Bill Blass, who is tall, slender and tawny and speaks with a cigarette dangling from his lower lip, was standing in his brown plaid Bill Blass suit ($175), his brown Bill Blass shirt ($22.50), his brown Bill Blass silk tie ($15)...
results.lead_paragraph: ONE day not long ago, Bill Blass, who is tall, slender and tawny and speaks with a cigarette dangling from his lower lip, was standing in his brown plaid Bill Blass suit ($175), his brown Bill Blass shirt ($22.50), his brown Bill Blass silk tie ($15) and brown Bill Blass buckled shoes ($50) in the center of the Bill Blass men's boutique at Bonwit Teller's.

results.abstract: A Tolkachev scores lack of toy trains in USSR, charges nation lags in providing educational and scientific toys, article, Pravda; toys in Moscow store described

headline.main: Russians Demanding More Up-to-Date Toys; Electric Trains Rare in World's Leading Railroad Country

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Dec. 24 -- As the New Year's gift season approaches, complaints are being voiced in the press that the Soviet Union, the world's leading railroad nation, cannot meet the demand for electric toy trains for its youngsters.

byline.original: By THEODORE SHABADSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Dec. 24 -- As the New Year's gift season approaches, complaints are being voiced in the press that the Soviet Union, the world's leading railroad nation, cannot meet the demand for electric toy trains for its youngsters.
